intro: Dryandra conferta var. parva, commonly known as the small-flowered dryandra, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, evergreen leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid conditions. It is a member of the genus Dryandra, which is known for its diverse and often ornamental species. This variety is distinguished by its smaller flowers and more compact growth habit compared to other members of the species.
